sections.name: History: The World Between the World Wars (1900-1950)
sections.description: Questions covering key events, ideologies, and figures from the period between the two World Wars.

questions.question: Which of the following treaties officially ended World War I and imposed harsh penalties on Germany?
Who was the leader of the Bolsheviks during the Russian Revolution of 1917?
The Great Depression, which began in 1929, primarily originated in which country?
Which ideology is characterized by extreme nationalism, authoritarianism, and the suppression of opposition?
What was the main purpose of the League of Nations, established after World War I?

sections.name: Geography: India - Resources and Development
sections.description: Questions on the natural resources, agriculture, industries, and development patterns of India.

questions.question: Which of the following is the most widely grown food crop in India?
The ______ plains are formed by the deposition of fertile alluvial soil by rivers originating from the Himalayas.
Which state in India is the largest producer of bauxite?
What is the primary source of irrigation in most parts of the Deccan Plateau?
The 'Green Revolution' in India was primarily aimed at increasing the production of:

sections.name: Civics: Indian Constitution and Government
sections.description: Questions on the fundamental principles of the Indian Constitution, different branches of government, and citizen rights.

questions.question: When was the Constitution of India adopted?
How many fundamental rights are guaranteed to the citizens of India by the Constitution?
Who is the head of the Indian Union executive?
The system of 'Panchayati Raj' in India is a form of:
Which body is responsible for conducting elections in India?

sections.name: Economics: Development and Economic Systems
sections.description: Questions on concepts of development, economic sectors, and various economic systems.

questions.question: Which of the following is considered a developed country?
The primary sector of the economy includes activities related to:
What does 'GDP' stand for in economics?
In a socialist economic system, who largely controls the means of production?
What is the main objective of sustainable development?
choices: Meeting the needs of the present without compromising the ability of future generations to meet their own needs
Promoting rapid industrialization at any cost
questions.answer: Meeting the needs of the present without compromising the ability of future generations to meet their own needs
